Extracted from methods. Context from paper: We identify specific steering vectors that, when modified, can significantly alter the model's alignment properties without affecting general capabilities Our work focuses on understanding how safety-relevant behaviors emerge in transformer architectures, particularly examining steering vectors in residual streams and their role in value learning Identification of steering vectors in transformer residual streams that correlate with value-aligned outputs

concept: Direction vectors in the transformer residual stream that, when added or subtracted, shift model outputs toward or away from value‑aligned behavior without changing overall capability.
